annotation.TEXT: Unlike the Robot Masters and Dark Man fights, the Wily Fortress bosses can actually be somewhat tough. Big Pets doesn't necessarily have a difficult pattern or anything like that, but he's made a bit more obnoxious by the fact that he only opens his eyes for a split second now. Even with his weakness, it's still kind of annoying to land hits on him.

Whatever the case, it often takes a while for good hacks to come out. I'll still be ready to play them (even though I'm sure everyone can agree that qzecwx is better/faster than me at them), though I can't help but admit: I really do hope the next notable hack we get is one for MM6. Seriously, aside from the two good/cancelled ones, MM6 has four Chiko hacks and a few basic level edits. It may not be the best in the series, but it at least deserves better than that.

As for the other entries: MM1...really isn't worth hacking in my opinion, unless you plan on ironing out its flaws first (same goes for MM2). MM3 already seems to have a decent handful of good hacks, along with MM4 (though with the latter, most tend to focus on 4MI). As for MM8...uhhh...while that would certainly be interesting, but I have no idea how anyone would go about doing that.

Granted, it's kind of basic in a few regards (aside from the splitting crystals and platform Camons, there's no real major modifications to the enemies). I also kind of wish more gimmicks were combined with the double jump in a few areas, but for what it's worth, it's still pretty fun on its own.

The Circring Q9 is also pretty annoying, but more-so for its weakness affiliation (Star Crash). Since it fires out projectiles, it can actively drain your ammo for Star Crash if you're not careful. Then again, if you are taking the "run face first into it" approach, your shield is pretty much always going to bounce off it with each hit anyways.

And there we go, another decent MM hack complete. Overall, while this isn't as extensive as some other hacks out there, it doesn't really need to in order to be enjoyable. It has one central gimmick that it rebuilds the game around, and for the most part, it works out pretty well.

This also isn't to say that it's a bad thing that we're getting more extensive hacks. Trust me, I have no qualms about playing a ROM hack if it's good. At the same time however, I feel some of the other entries in the series could use a bit more attention.

Normally this is where I'd cut the recording for the next segment, but the entirety of the Proto Man castle only lasted around 7 minutes. Since I don't like ending segments that early, I may as well go to the Wily fortress and finish up the rest of the game.

On that note however, this hack did get me wondering about something. As I mentioned in the first part, there's an overabundance of MM2 hacks out there. Now it could just be me, but...does anyone else feel that MM5 is getting to that point as well - albeit to a far lesser extent?

Looking back on this, I think using weapons against the Dark Man bosses is a bit overkill. All of them - while modified in some way - are very easy to deal with, especially in the case of this first one (all he really does is jump and occasionally fires a few slow moving projectiles).

I think I've gone on record in stating that Dark Man II is my least favorite boss in the entire classic series (mostly because his only method of "attacking" is to bump into you). Thankfully someone saw fit to change this, because this version of him actually does things.

Of course MM5 doesn't have nearly as many hacks as MM2, but I wouldn't be surprised if it turned out to have the second most entries as far as notable hacks go (even when omitting most of Chiko's rubbish in the process).

At the time of writing this annotation, the only really extensive hacks for MM6 are Skype and Innocent, both of which were cancelled. Out of all the games in the classic series, I feel that 6 is in need of a good hack the most (I also wouldn't be opposed to an extensive MM7 hack, provided someone can actually get that sort of thing to work).

The Wily Capsule actually has a few attacks that it didn't show off here. Aside from the more traditional-styled Capsule projectiles, he can also appear near the floor and sort of zig-zag towards you (which isn't really the best attack to get from him either, seeing as it doesn't give that much of a decent opportunity to hit him).
